  3. (*                                 OCaml                                  *)

  16. (* Elimination of useless Llet(Alias) bindings.
  17.    Also transform let-bound references into variables. *)

  19. open Asttypes
  20. open Lambda
  21. open Debuginfo.Scoped_location

  23. (* To transform let-bound references into variables *)

  25. exception Real_reference

  27. ‌let rec eliminate_ref id = function
  28.     Lvar v as lam ->
  29.       if Ident.same v id then raise Real_reference else lam
  30.   | Lmutvar _ | Lconst _ as lam -> lam
  31.   | Lapply ap ->
  32.       Lapply{ap with ap_func = eliminate_ref id ap.ap_func;
  33.                      ap_args = List.map (eliminate_ref id) ap.ap_args}
  34.   | Lfunction _ as lam ->
  35.       if Ident.Set.mem id (free_variables lam)
  36.       then raise Real_reference
  37.       else lam
  38.   | Llet(str, kind, v, e1, e2) ->
  39.       Llet(str, kind, v, eliminate_ref id e1, eliminate_ref id e2)
  40.   | Lmutlet(kind, v, e1, e2) ->
  41.       Lmutlet(kind, v, eliminate_ref id e1, eliminate_ref id e2)
  42.   | Lletrec(idel, e2) ->
  43.       Lletrec(List.map (fun (v, e) -> (v, eliminate_ref id e)) idel,
  44.               eliminate_ref id e2)
  45.   | Lprim(Pfield (0, _, _), [Lvar v], _) when Ident.same v id ->
  46.       Lmutvar id
  47.   | Lprim(Psetfield(0, _, _), [Lvar v; e], _) when Ident.same v id ->
  48.       Lassign(id, eliminate_ref id e)
  49.   | Lprim(Poffsetref delta, [Lvar v], loc) when Ident.same v id ->
  50.       Lassign(id, Lprim(Poffsetint delta, [Lmutvar id], loc))
  51.   | Lprim(p, el, loc) ->
  52.       Lprim(p, List.map (eliminate_ref id) el, loc)
  53.   | Lswitch(e, sw, loc) ->
  54.       Lswitch(eliminate_ref id e,
  55.         {sw_numconsts = sw.sw_numconsts;
  56.          sw_consts =
  57.             List.map (fun (n, e) -> (n, eliminate_ref id e)) sw.sw_consts;
  58.          sw_numblocks = sw.sw_numblocks;
  59.          sw_blocks =
  60.             List.map (fun (n, e) -> (n, eliminate_ref id e)) sw.sw_blocks;
  61.          sw_failaction =
  62.             Option.map (eliminate_ref id) sw.sw_failaction; },
  63.         loc)
  64.   | Lstringswitch(e, sw, default, loc) ->
  65.       Lstringswitch
  66.         (eliminate_ref id e,
  67.          List.map (fun (s, e) -> (s, eliminate_ref id e)) sw,
  68.          Option.map (eliminate_ref id) default, loc)
  69.   | Lstaticraise (i,args) ->
  70.       Lstaticraise (i,List.map (eliminate_ref id) args)
  71.   | Lstaticcatch(e1, i, e2) ->
  72.       Lstaticcatch(eliminate_ref id e1, i, eliminate_ref id e2)
  73.   | Ltrywith(e1, v, e2) ->
  74.       Ltrywith(eliminate_ref id e1, v, eliminate_ref id e2)
  75.   | Lifthenelse(e1, e2, e3) ->
  76.       Lifthenelse(eliminate_ref id e1,
  77.                   eliminate_ref id e2,
  78.                   eliminate_ref id e3)
  79.   | Lsequence(e1, e2) ->
  80.       Lsequence(eliminate_ref id e1, eliminate_ref id e2)
  81.   | Lwhile(e1, e2) ->
  82.       Lwhile(eliminate_ref id e1, eliminate_ref id e2)
  83.   | Lfor(v, e1, e2, dir, e3) ->
  84.       Lfor(v, eliminate_ref id e1, eliminate_ref id e2,
  85.            dir, eliminate_ref id e3)
  86.   | Lassign(v, e) ->
  87.       Lassign(v, eliminate_ref id e)
  88.   | Lsend(k, m, o, el, loc) ->
  89.       Lsend(k, eliminate_ref id m, eliminate_ref id o,
  90.             List.map (eliminate_ref id) el, loc)
  91.   | Levent(l, ev) ->
  92.       Levent(eliminate_ref id l, ev)
  93.   | Lifused(v, e) ->
  94.       Lifused(v, eliminate_ref id e)

  96. (* Simplification of exits *)

  98. ‌type exit = {
  99.   mutable count: int;
  100.   mutable max_depth: int;
  101. }

  103. ‌let simplify_exits lam =

  105.   (* Count occurrences of (exit n ...) statements *)
  106.   let exits = Hashtbl.create 17 in

  108.   let get_exit i =
  109.     try Hashtbl.find exits i
  110.     with Not_found -> {count = 0; max_depth = 0}

  112.   and incr_exit i nb d =
  113.     match Hashtbl.find_opt exits i with
  114.     | Some r ->
  115.         r.count <- r.count + nb;
  116.         r.max_depth <- Int.max r.max_depth d
  117.     | None ->
  118.         let r = {count = nb; max_depth = d} in
  119.         Hashtbl.add exits i r
  120.   in

  122.   let rec count ~try_depth = function
  123.   | (Lvar _| Lmutvar _ | Lconst _) -> ()
  124.   | Lapply ap ->
  125.       count ~try_depth ap.ap_func;
  126.       List.iter (count ~try_depth) ap.ap_args
  127.   | Lfunction {body} -> count ~try_depth body
  128.   | Llet(_, _kind, _v, l1, l2)
  129.   | Lmutlet(_kind, _v, l1, l2) ->
  130.       count ~try_depth l2; count ~try_depth l1
  131.   | Lletrec(bindings, body) ->
  132.       List.iter (fun (_v, l) -> count ~try_depth l) bindings;
  133.       count ~try_depth body
  134.   | Lprim(_p, ll, _) -> List.iter (count ~try_depth) ll
  135.   | Lswitch(l, sw, _loc) ->
  136.       count_default ~try_depth sw ;
  137.       count ~try_depth l;
  138.       List.iter (fun (_, l) -> count ~try_depth l) sw.sw_consts;
  139.       List.iter (fun (_, l) -> count ~try_depth l) sw.sw_blocks
  140.   | Lstringswitch(l, sw, d, _) ->
  141.       count ~try_depth l;
  142.       List.iter (fun (_, l) -> count ~try_depth l) sw;
  143.       begin match  d with
  144.       | None -> ()
  145.       | Some d -> match sw with
  146.         | []|[_] -> count ~try_depth d
  147.         | _ -> (* default will get replicated *)
  148.             count ~try_depth d; count ~try_depth d
  149.       end
  150.   | Lstaticraise (i,ls) ->
  151.       incr_exit i 1 try_depth;
  152.       List.iter (count ~try_depth) ls
  153.   | Lstaticcatch (l1,(i,[]),Lstaticraise (j,[])) ->
  154.       (* i will be replaced by j in l1, so each occurrence of i in l1
  155.          increases j's ref count *)
  156.       count ~try_depth l1 ;
  157.       let ic = get_exit i in
  158.       incr_exit j ic.count (Int.max try_depth ic.max_depth)
  159.   | Lstaticcatch(l1, (i,_), l2) ->
  160.       count ~try_depth l1;
  161.       (* If l1 does not contain (exit i),
  162.          l2 will be removed, so don't count its exits *)
  163.       if (get_exit i).count > 0 then
  164.         count ~try_depth l2
  165.   | Ltrywith(l1, _v, l2) ->
  166.       count ~try_depth:(try_depth+1) l1;
  167.       count ~try_depth l2;
  168.   | Lifthenelse(l1, l2, l3) ->
  169.       count ~try_depth l1;
  170.       count ~try_depth l2;
  171.       count ~try_depth l3
  172.   | Lsequence(l1, l2) -> count ~try_depth l1; count ~try_depth l2
  173.   | Lwhile(l1, l2) -> count ~try_depth l1; count ~try_depth l2
  174.   | Lfor(_, l1, l2, _dir, l3) ->
  175.       count ~try_depth l1;
  176.       count ~try_depth l2;
  177.       count ~try_depth l3
  178.   | Lassign(_v, l) -> count ~try_depth l
  179.   | Lsend(_k, m, o, ll, _) -> List.iter (count ~try_depth) (m::o::ll)
  180.   | Levent(l, _) -> count ~try_depth l
  181.   | Lifused(_v, l) -> count ~try_depth l

  183. ‌  and count_default ~try_depth sw = match sw.sw_failaction with
  184.   | None -> ()
  185.   | Some al ->
  186.       let nconsts = List.length sw.sw_consts
  187.       and nblocks = List.length sw.sw_blocks in
  188.       if
  189.         nconsts < sw.sw_numconsts && nblocks < sw.sw_numblocks
  190.       then begin (* default action will occur twice in native code *)
  191.         count ~try_depth al ; count ~try_depth al
  192.       end else begin (* default action will occur once *)
  193.         assert (nconsts < sw.sw_numconsts || nblocks < sw.sw_numblocks) ;
  194.         count ~try_depth al
  195.       end
  196.   in
  197.   count ~try_depth:0 lam;

  199.   (*
  200.      Second pass simplify  ``catch body with (i ...) handler''
  201.       - if (exit i ...) does not occur in body, suppress catch
  202.       - if (exit i ...) occurs exactly once in body,
  203.         substitute it with handler
  204.       - If handler is a single variable, replace (exit i ..) with it
  205.    Note:
  206.     In ``catch body with (i x1 .. xn) handler''
  207.      Substituted expression is
  208.       let y1 = x1 and ... yn = xn in
  209.       handler[x1 <- y1 ; ... ; xn <- yn]
  210.      For the sake of preserving the uniqueness  of bound variables.
  211.      (No alpha conversion of ``handler'' is presently needed, since
  212.      substitution of several ``(exit i ...)''
  213.      occurs only when ``handler'' is a variable.)
  214.   *)

  216.   let subst = Hashtbl.create 17 in
  217. ‌  let rec simplif ~try_depth = function
  218.   | (Lvar _| Lmutvar _ | Lconst _) as l -> l
  219.   | Lapply ap ->
  220.       Lapply{ap with ap_func = simplif ~try_depth ap.ap_func;
  221.                      ap_args = List.map (simplif ~try_depth) ap.ap_args}
  222.   | Lfunction{kind; params; return; body = l; attr; loc} ->
  223.      lfunction ~kind ~params ~return ~body:(simplif ~try_depth l) ~attr ~loc
  224.   | Llet(str, kind, v, l1, l2) ->
  225.       Llet(str, kind, v, simplif ~try_depth l1, simplif ~try_depth l2)
  226.   | Lmutlet(kind, v, l1, l2) ->
  227.       Lmutlet(kind, v, simplif ~try_depth l1, simplif ~try_depth l2)
  228.   | Lletrec(bindings, body) ->
  229.       Lletrec(List.map (fun (v, l) -> (v, simplif ~try_depth l)) bindings,
  230.       simplif ~try_depth body)
  231.   | Lprim(p, ll, loc) -> begin
  232.     let ll = List.map (simplif ~try_depth) ll in
  233.     match p, ll with
  234.         (* Simplify Obj.with_tag *)
  235.       | Pccall { Primitive.prim_name = "caml_obj_with_tag"; _ },
  236.         [Lconst (Const_base (Const_int tag));
  237.          Lprim (Pmakeblock (_, mut, shape), fields, loc)] ->
  238.          Lprim (Pmakeblock(tag, mut, shape), fields, loc)
  239.       | Pccall { Primitive.prim_name = "caml_obj_with_tag"; _ },
  240.         [Lconst (Const_base (Const_int tag));
  241.          Lconst (Const_block (_, fields))] ->
  242.          Lconst (Const_block (tag, fields))

  244.       | _ -> Lprim(p, ll, loc)
  245.      end
  246.   | Lswitch(l, sw, loc) ->
  247.       let new_l = simplif ~try_depth l
  248.       and new_consts =
  249.       List.map (fun (n, e) -> (n, simplif ~try_depth e)) sw.sw_consts
  250.       and new_blocks =
  251.       List.map (fun (n, e) -> (n, simplif ~try_depth e)) sw.sw_blocks
  252.       and new_fail = Option.map (simplif ~try_depth) sw.sw_failaction in
  253.       Lswitch
  254.         (new_l,
  255.          {sw with sw_consts = new_consts ; sw_blocks = new_blocks;
  256.                   sw_failaction = new_fail},
  257.          loc)
  258.   | Lstringswitch(l,sw,d,loc) ->
  259.       Lstringswitch
  260.         (simplif ~try_depth l,List.map (fun (s,l) -> s,simplif ~try_depth l) sw,
  261.          Option.map (simplif ~try_depth) d,loc)
  262.   | Lstaticraise (i,[]) as l ->
  263.       begin try
  264.         let _,handler =  Hashtbl.find subst i in
  265.         handler
  266.       with
  267.       | Not_found -> l
  268.       end
  269.   | Lstaticraise (i,ls) ->
  270.       let ls = List.map (simplif ~try_depth) ls in
  271.       begin try
  272.         let xs,handler =  Hashtbl.find subst i in
  273.         let ys = List.map (fun (x, k) -> Ident.rename x, k) xs in
  274.         let env =
  275.           List.fold_right2
  276.             (fun (x, _) (y, _) env -> Ident.Map.add x y env)
  277.             xs ys Ident.Map.empty
  278.         in
  279.         (* The evaluation order for Lstaticraise arguments is currently
  280.            right-to-left in all backends.
  281.            To preserve this, we use fold_left2 instead of fold_right2
  282.            (the first argument is inserted deepest in the expression,
  283.            so will be evaluated last).
  284.         *)
  285.         List.fold_left2
  286.           (fun r (y, kind) l -> Llet (Strict, kind, y, l, r))
  287.           (Lambda.rename env handler) ys ls
  288.       with
  289.       | Not_found -> Lstaticraise (i,ls)
  290.       end
  291.   | Lstaticcatch (l1,(i,[]),(Lstaticraise (_j,[]) as l2)) ->
  292.       Hashtbl.add subst i ([],simplif ~try_depth l2) ;
  293.       simplif ~try_depth l1
  294.   | Lstaticcatch (l1,(i,xs),l2) ->
  295.       let {count; max_depth} = get_exit i in
  296.       if count = 0 then
  297.         (* Discard staticcatch: not matching exit *)
  298.         simplif ~try_depth l1
  299.       else if
  300.       count = 1 && max_depth <= try_depth then begin
  301.         (* Inline handler if there is a single occurrence and it is not
  302.            nested within an inner try..with *)
  303.         assert(max_depth = try_depth);
  304.         Hashtbl.add subst i (xs,simplif ~try_depth l2);
  305.         simplif ~try_depth l1
  306.       end else
  307.         Lstaticcatch (simplif ~try_depth l1, (i,xs), simplif ~try_depth l2)
  308.   | Ltrywith(l1, v, l2) ->
  309.       let l1 = simplif ~try_depth:(try_depth + 1) l1 in
  310.       Ltrywith(l1, v, simplif ~try_depth l2)
  311.   | Lifthenelse(l1, l2, l3) -> Lifthenelse(simplif ~try_depth l1,
  312.     simplif ~try_depth l2, simplif ~try_depth l3)
  313.   | Lsequence(l1, l2) -> Lsequence(simplif ~try_depth l1, simplif ~try_depth l2)
  314.   | Lwhile(l1, l2) -> Lwhile(simplif ~try_depth l1, simplif ~try_depth l2)
  315.   | Lfor(v, l1, l2, dir, l3) ->
  316.       Lfor(v, simplif ~try_depth l1, simplif ~try_depth l2, dir,
  317.       simplif ~try_depth l3)
  318.   | Lassign(v, l) -> Lassign(v, simplif ~try_depth l)
  319.   | Lsend(k, m, o, ll, loc) ->
  320.       Lsend(k, simplif ~try_depth m, simplif ~try_depth o,
  321.       List.map (simplif ~try_depth) ll, loc)
  322.   | Levent(l, ev) -> Levent(simplif ~try_depth l, ev)
  323.   | Lifused(v, l) -> Lifused (v,simplif ~try_depth l)
  324.   in
  325.   simplif ~try_depth:0 lam

  327. (* Compile-time beta-reduction of functions immediately applied:
  328.       Lapply(Lfunction(Curried, params, body), args, loc) ->
  329.         let paramN = argN in ... let param1 = arg1 in body
  330.       Lapply(Lfunction(Tupled, params, body), [Lprim(Pmakeblock(args))], loc) ->
  331.         let paramN = argN in ... let param1 = arg1 in body
  332.    Assumes |args| = |params|.
  333. *)

  335. let exact_application {kind; params; _} args =
  336.   let arity = List.length params in
  337.   Lambda.find_exact_application kind ~arity args

  339. ‌let beta_reduce params body args =
  340.   List.fold_left2 (fun l (param, kind) arg -> Llet(Strict, kind, param, arg, l))
  341.                   body params args

  343. (* Simplification of lets *)

  345. let simplify_lets lam =

  347.   (* Disable optimisations for bytecode compilation with -g flag *)
  348.   let optimize = !Clflags.native_code || not !Clflags.debug in

  350.   (* First pass: count the occurrences of all let-bound identifiers *)

  352. ‌  let occ = (Hashtbl.create 83: (Ident.t, int ref) Hashtbl.t) in
  353.   (* The global table [occ] associates to each let-bound identifier
  354.      the number of its uses (as a reference):
  355.      - 0 if never used
  356.      - 1 if used exactly once in and not under a lambda or within a loop
  357.      - > 1 if used several times or under a lambda or within a loop.
  358.      The local table [bv] associates to each locally-let-bound variable
  359.      its reference count, as above.  [bv] is enriched at let bindings
  360.      but emptied when crossing lambdas and loops. *)

  362.   (* Current use count of a variable. *)
  363. ‌  let count_var v =
  364.     try
  365.       !(Hashtbl.find occ v)
  366.     with Not_found ->
  367.       0

  369.   (* Entering a [let].  Returns updated [bv]. *)
  370.   and bind_var bv v =
  371.     let r = ref 0 in
  372.     Hashtbl.add occ v r;
  373.     Ident.Map.add v r bv

  375.   (* Record a use of a variable *)
  376.   and use_var bv v n =
  377.     try
  378.       let r = Ident.Map.find v bv in r := !r + n
  379.     with Not_found ->
  380.       (* v is not locally bound, therefore this is a use under a lambda
  381.          or within a loop.  Increase use count by 2 -- enough so
  382.          that single-use optimizations will not apply. *)
  383.     try
  384.       let r = Hashtbl.find occ v in r := !r + 2
  385.     with Not_found ->
  386.       (* Not a let-bound variable, ignore *)
  387.       () in

  389.   let rec count bv = function
  390.   | Lconst _ -> ()
  391.   | Lvar v ->
  392.      use_var bv v 1
  393.   | Lmutvar _ -> ()
  394.   | Lapply{ap_func = ll; ap_args = args} ->
  395.       let no_opt () = count bv ll; List.iter (count bv) args in
  396.       begin match ll with
  397.       | Lfunction lf when optimize ->
  398.           begin match exact_application lf args with
  399.           | None -> no_opt ()
  400.           | Some exact_args ->
  401.               count bv (beta_reduce lf.params lf.body exact_args)
  402.           end
  403.       | _ -> no_opt ()
  404.       end
  405.   | Lfunction {body} ->
  406.       count Ident.Map.empty body
  407.   | Llet(_str, _k, v, Lvar w, l2) when optimize ->
  408.       (* v will be replaced by w in l2, so each occurrence of v in l2
  409.          increases w's refcount *)
  410.       count (bind_var bv v) l2;
  411.       use_var bv w (count_var v)
  412.   | Llet(str, _kind, v, l1, l2) ->
  413.       count (bind_var bv v) l2;
  414.       (* If v is unused, l1 will be removed, so don't count its variables *)
  415.       if str = Strict || count_var v > 0 then count bv l1
  416.   | Lmutlet(_kind, _v, l1, l2) ->
  417.      count bv l1;
  418.      count bv l2
  419.   | Lletrec(bindings, body) ->
  420.       List.iter (fun (_v, l) -> count bv l) bindings;
  421.       count bv body
  422.   | Lprim(_p, ll, _) -> List.iter (count bv) ll
  423.   | Lswitch(l, sw, _loc) ->
  424.       count_default bv sw ;
  425.       count bv l;
  426.       List.iter (fun (_, l) -> count bv l) sw.sw_consts;
  427.       List.iter (fun (_, l) -> count bv l) sw.sw_blocks
  428.   | Lstringswitch(l, sw, d, _) ->
  429.       count bv l ;
  430.       List.iter (fun (_, l) -> count bv l) sw ;
  431.       begin match d with
  432.       | Some d ->
  433.           begin match sw with
  434.           | []|[_] -> count bv d
  435.           | _ -> count bv d ; count bv d
  436.           end
  437.       | None -> ()
  438.       end
  439.   | Lstaticraise (_i,ls) -> List.iter (count bv) ls
  440.   | Lstaticcatch(l1, _, l2) -> count bv l1; count bv l2
  441.   | Ltrywith(l1, _v, l2) -> count bv l1; count bv l2
  442.   | Lifthenelse(l1, l2, l3) -> count bv l1; count bv l2; count bv l3
  443.   | Lsequence(l1, l2) -> count bv l1; count bv l2
  444.   | Lwhile(l1, l2) -> count Ident.Map.empty l1; count Ident.Map.empty l2
  445.   | Lfor(_, l1, l2, _dir, l3) ->
  446.       count bv l1; count bv l2; count Ident.Map.empty l3
  447.   | Lassign(_v, l) ->
  448.       (* Lalias-bound variables are never assigned, so don't increase
  449.          v's refcount *)
  450.       count bv l
  451.   | Lsend(_, m, o, ll, _) -> List.iter (count bv) (m::o::ll)
  452.   | Levent(l, _) -> count bv l
  453.   | Lifused(v, l) ->
  454.       if count_var v > 0 then count bv l

  456. ‌  and count_default bv sw = match sw.sw_failaction with
  457.   | None -> ()
  458.   | Some al ->
  459.       let nconsts = List.length sw.sw_consts
  460.       and nblocks = List.length sw.sw_blocks in
  461.       if
  462.         nconsts < sw.sw_numconsts && nblocks < sw.sw_numblocks
  463.       then begin (* default action will occur twice in native code *)
  464.         count bv al ; count bv al
  465.       end else begin (* default action will occur once *)
  466.         assert (nconsts < sw.sw_numconsts || nblocks < sw.sw_numblocks) ;
  467.         count bv al
  468.       end
  469.   in
  470.   count Ident.Map.empty lam;

  472.   (* Second pass: remove Lalias bindings of unused variables,
  473.      and substitute the bindings of variables used exactly once. *)

  475. ‌  let subst = Hashtbl.create 83 in

  477. (* This (small)  optimisation is always legal, it may uncover some
  478.    tail call later on. *)

  480. ‌  let mklet str kind v e1 e2 =
  481.     match e2 with
  482.     | Lvar w when optimize && Ident.same v w -> e1
  483.     | _ -> Llet (str, kind,v,e1,e2)
  484.   in

  486. ‌  let mkmutlet kind v e1 e2 =
  487.     match e2 with
  488.     | Lmutvar w when optimize && Ident.same v w -> e1
  489.     | _ -> Lmutlet (kind,v,e1,e2)
  490.   in

  492. ‌  let rec simplif = function
  493.     Lvar v as l ->
  494.       begin try
  495.         Hashtbl.find subst v
  496.       with Not_found ->
  497.         l
  498.       end
  499.   | Lmutvar _ | Lconst _ as l -> l
  500.   | Lapply ({ap_func = ll; ap_args = args} as ap) ->
  501.       let no_opt () =
  502.         Lapply {ap with ap_func = simplif ap.ap_func;
  503.                         ap_args = List.map simplif ap.ap_args} in
  504.       begin match ll with
  505.       | Lfunction lf when optimize ->
  506.           begin match exact_application lf args with
  507.           | None -> no_opt ()
  508.           | Some exact_args ->
  509.               simplif (beta_reduce lf.params lf.body exact_args)
  510.           end
  511.       | _ -> no_opt ()
  512.       end
  513.   | Lfunction{kind; params; return=return1; body = l; attr; loc} ->
  514.       begin match simplif l with
  515.         Lfunction{kind=Curried; params=params'; return=return2; body; attr; loc}
  516.         when kind = Curried && optimize &&
  517.              List.length params + List.length params' <= Lambda.max_arity() ->
  518.           (* The return type is the type of the value returned after
  519.              applying all the parameters to the function. The return
  520.              type of the merged function taking [params @ params'] as
  521.              parameters is the type returned after applying [params']. *)
  522.           let return = return2 in
  523.           lfunction ~kind ~params:(params @ params') ~return ~body ~attr ~loc
  524.       | body ->
  525.           lfunction ~kind ~params ~return:return1 ~body ~attr ~loc
  526.       end
  527.   | Llet(_str, _k, v, Lvar w, l2) when optimize ->
  528.       Hashtbl.add subst v (simplif (Lvar w));
  529.       simplif l2
  530.   | Llet(Strict, kind, v,
  531.          Lprim(Pmakeblock(0, Mutable, kind_ref) as prim, [linit], loc), lbody)
  532.     when optimize ->
  533.       let slinit = simplif linit in
  534.       let slbody = simplif lbody in
  535.       begin try
  536.         let kind = match kind_ref with
  537.           | None -> Pgenval
  538.           | Some [field_kind] -> field_kind
  539.           | Some _ -> assert false
  540.         in
  541.         mkmutlet kind v slinit (eliminate_ref v slbody)
  542.       with Real_reference ->
  543.         mklet Strict kind v (Lprim(prim, [slinit], loc)) slbody
  544.       end
  545.   | Llet(Alias, kind, v, l1, l2) ->
  546.       begin match count_var v with
  547.         0 -> simplif l2
  548.       | 1 when optimize -> Hashtbl.add subst v (simplif l1); simplif l2
  549.       | _ -> Llet(Alias, kind, v, simplif l1, simplif l2)
  550.       end
  551.   | Llet(StrictOpt, kind, v, l1, l2) ->
  552.       begin match count_var v with
  553.         0 -> simplif l2
  554.       | _ -> mklet StrictOpt kind v (simplif l1) (simplif l2)
  555.       end
  556.   | Llet(str, kind, v, l1, l2) -> mklet str kind v (simplif l1) (simplif l2)
  557.   | Lmutlet(kind, v, l1, l2) -> mkmutlet kind v (simplif l1) (simplif l2)
  558.   | Lletrec(bindings, body) ->
  559.       Lletrec(List.map (fun (v, l) -> (v, simplif l)) bindings, simplif body)
  560.   | Lprim(p, ll, loc) -> Lprim(p, List.map simplif ll, loc)
  561.   | Lswitch(l, sw, loc) ->
  562.       let new_l = simplif l
  563.       and new_consts =  List.map (fun (n, e) -> (n, simplif e)) sw.sw_consts
  564.       and new_blocks =  List.map (fun (n, e) -> (n, simplif e)) sw.sw_blocks
  565.       and new_fail = Option.map simplif sw.sw_failaction in
  566.       Lswitch
  567.         (new_l,
  568.          {sw with sw_consts = new_consts ; sw_blocks = new_blocks;
  569.                   sw_failaction = new_fail},
  570.          loc)
  571.   | Lstringswitch (l,sw,d,loc) ->
  572.       Lstringswitch
  573.         (simplif l,List.map (fun (s,l) -> s,simplif l) sw,
  574.          Option.map simplif d,loc)
  575.   | Lstaticraise (i,ls) ->
  576.       Lstaticraise (i, List.map simplif ls)
  577.   | Lstaticcatch(l1, (i,args), l2) ->
  578.       Lstaticcatch (simplif l1, (i,args), simplif l2)
  579.   | Ltrywith(l1, v, l2) -> Ltrywith(simplif l1, v, simplif l2)
  580.   | Lifthenelse(l1, l2, l3) -> Lifthenelse(simplif l1, simplif l2, simplif l3)
  581.   | Lsequence(Lifused(v, l1), l2) ->
  582.       if count_var v > 0
  583.       then Lsequence(simplif l1, simplif l2)
  584.       else simplif l2
  585.   | Lsequence(l1, l2) -> Lsequence(simplif l1, simplif l2)
  586.   | Lwhile(l1, l2) -> Lwhile(simplif l1, simplif l2)
  587.   | Lfor(v, l1, l2, dir, l3) ->
  588.       Lfor(v, simplif l1, simplif l2, dir, simplif l3)
  589.   | Lassign(v, l) -> Lassign(v, simplif l)
  590.   | Lsend(k, m, o, ll, loc) ->
  591.       Lsend(k, simplif m, simplif o, List.map simplif ll, loc)
  592.   | Levent(l, ev) -> Levent(simplif l, ev)
  593.   | Lifused(v, l) ->
  594.       if count_var v > 0 then simplif l else lambda_unit
  595.   in
  596.   simplif lam

  598. (* Tail call info in annotation files *)

  600. ‌let rec emit_tail_infos is_tail lambda =
  601.   match lambda with
  602.   | Lvar _ -> ()
  603.   | Lmutvar _ -> ()
  604.   | Lconst _ -> ()
  605.   | Lapply ap ->
  606.       begin
  607.         (* Note: is_tail does not take backend-specific logic into
  608.            account (maximum number of parameters, etc.)  so it may
  609.            over-approximate tail-callness.

  611.            Trying to do something more fine-grained would result in
  612.            different warnings depending on whether the native or
  613.            bytecode compiler is used. *)
  614.         let maybe_warn ~is_tail ~expect_tail =
  615.           if is_tail <> expect_tail then
  616.             Location.prerr_warning (to_location ap.ap_loc)
  617.               (Warnings.Wrong_tailcall_expectation expect_tail) in
  618.         match ap.ap_tailcall with
  619.         | Default_tailcall -> ()
  620.         | Tailcall_expectation expect_tail ->
  621.             maybe_warn ~is_tail ~expect_tail
  622.       end;
  623.       emit_tail_infos false ap.ap_func;
  624.       list_emit_tail_infos false ap.ap_args
  625.   | Lfunction {body = lam} ->
  626.       emit_tail_infos true lam
  627.   | Llet (_, _k, _, lam, body)
  628.   | Lmutlet (_k, _, lam, body) ->
  629.       emit_tail_infos false lam;
  630.       emit_tail_infos is_tail body
  631.   | Lletrec (bindings, body) ->
  632.       List.iter (fun (_, lam) -> emit_tail_infos false lam) bindings;
  633.       emit_tail_infos is_tail body
  634.   | Lprim ((Pbytes_to_string | Pbytes_of_string), [arg], _) ->
  635.       emit_tail_infos is_tail arg
  636.   | Lprim (Psequand, [arg1; arg2], _)
  637.   | Lprim (Psequor, [arg1; arg2], _) ->
  638.       emit_tail_infos false arg1;
  639.       emit_tail_infos is_tail arg2
  640.   | Lprim (_, l, _) ->
  641.       list_emit_tail_infos false l
  642.   | Lswitch (lam, sw, _loc) ->
  643.       emit_tail_infos false lam;
  644.       list_emit_tail_infos_fun snd is_tail sw.sw_consts;
  645.       list_emit_tail_infos_fun snd is_tail sw.sw_blocks;
  646.       Option.iter  (emit_tail_infos is_tail) sw.sw_failaction
  647.   | Lstringswitch (lam, sw, d, _) ->
  648.       emit_tail_infos false lam;
  649.       List.iter
  650.         (fun (_,lam) ->  emit_tail_infos is_tail lam)
  651.         sw ;
  652.       Option.iter (emit_tail_infos is_tail) d
  653.   | Lstaticraise (_, l) ->
  654.       list_emit_tail_infos false l
  655.   | Lstaticcatch (body, _, handler) ->
  656.       emit_tail_infos is_tail body;
  657.       emit_tail_infos is_tail handler
  658.   | Ltrywith (body, _, handler) ->
  659.       emit_tail_infos false body;
  660.       emit_tail_infos is_tail handler
  661.   | Lifthenelse (cond, ifso, ifno) ->
  662.       emit_tail_infos false cond;
  663.       emit_tail_infos is_tail ifso;
  664.       emit_tail_infos is_tail ifno
  665.   | Lsequence (lam1, lam2) ->
  666.       emit_tail_infos false lam1;
  667.       emit_tail_infos is_tail lam2
  668.   | Lwhile (cond, body) ->
  669.       emit_tail_infos false cond;
  670.       emit_tail_infos false body
  671.   | Lfor (_, low, high, _, body) ->
  672.       emit_tail_infos false low;
  673.       emit_tail_infos false high;
  674.       emit_tail_infos false body
  675.   | Lassign (_, lam) ->
  676.       emit_tail_infos false lam
  677.   | Lsend (_, meth, obj, args, _loc) ->
  678.       emit_tail_infos false meth;
  679.       emit_tail_infos false obj;
  680.       list_emit_tail_infos false args
  681.   | Levent (lam, _) ->
  682.       emit_tail_infos is_tail lam
  683.   | Lifused (_, lam) ->
  684.       emit_tail_infos is_tail lam
  685. and list_emit_tail_infos_fun f is_tail =
  686.   List.iter (fun x -> emit_tail_infos is_tail (f x))
  687. and list_emit_tail_infos is_tail =
  688.   List.iter (emit_tail_infos is_tail)

  690. (* Split a function with default parameters into a wrapper and an
  691.    inner function.  The wrapper fills in missing optional parameters
  692.    with their default value and tail-calls the inner function.  The
  693.    wrapper can then hopefully be inlined on most call sites to avoid
  694.    the overhead associated with boxing an optional argument with a
  695.    'Some' constructor, only to deconstruct it immediately in the
  696.    function's body. *)

  698. let split_default_wrapper ~id:fun_id ~kind ~params ~return ~body ~attr ~loc =
  699.   let rec aux map = function
  700.     (* When compiling [fun ?(x=expr) -> body], this is first translated
  701.        to:
  702.        [fun *opt* ->
  703.           let x =
  704.             match *opt* with
  705.             | None -> expr
  706.             | Some *sth* -> *sth*
  707.           in
  708.           body]
  709.        We want to detect the let binding to put it into the wrapper instead of
  710.        the inner function.
  711.        We need to find which optional parameter the binding corresponds to,
  712.        which is why we need a deep pattern matching on the expected result of
  713.        the pattern-matching compiler for options.
  714.     *)
  715.     | Llet(Strict, k, id,
  716.            (Lifthenelse(Lprim (Pisint, [Lvar optparam], _), _, _) as def),
  717.            rest) when
  718.         Ident.name optparam = "*opt*" && List.mem_assoc optparam params
  719.           && not (List.mem_assoc optparam map)
  720.       ->
  721.         let wrapper_body, inner = aux ((optparam, id) :: map) rest in
  722.         Llet(Strict, k, id, def, wrapper_body), inner
  723.     | _ when map = [] -> raise Exit
  724.     | body ->
  725.         (* Check that those *opt* identifiers don't appear in the remaining
  726.            body. This should not appear, but let's be on the safe side. *)
  727. ‌        let fv = Lambda.free_variables body in
  728.         List.iter (fun (id, _) -> if Ident.Set.mem id fv then raise Exit) map;

  730. ‌        let inner_id = Ident.create_local (Ident.name fun_id ^ "_inner") in
  731. ‌        let map_param p = try List.assoc p map with Not_found -> p in
  732. ‌        let args = List.map (fun (p, _) -> Lvar (map_param p)) params in
  733. ‌        let wrapper_body =
  734.           Lapply {
  735.             ap_func = Lvar inner_id;
  736.             ap_args = args;
  737.             ap_loc = Loc_unknown;
  738.             ap_tailcall = Default_tailcall;
  739.             ap_inlined = Default_inline;
  740.             ap_specialised = Default_specialise;
  741.           }
  742.         in
  743. ‌        let inner_params = List.map map_param (List.map fst params) in
  744. ‌        let new_ids = List.map Ident.rename inner_params in
  745. ‌        let subst =
  746.           List.fold_left2 (fun s id new_id ->
  747.             Ident.Map.add id new_id s
  748.           ) Ident.Map.empty inner_params new_ids
  749.         in
  750. ‌        let body = Lambda.rename subst body in
  751. ‌        let inner_fun =
  752.           lfunction ~kind:Curried
  753.             ~params:(List.map (fun id -> id, Pgenval) new_ids)
  754.             ~return ~body ~attr ~loc
  755.         in
  756.         (wrapper_body, (inner_id, inner_fun))
  757.   in
  758.   try
  759. ‌    let body, inner = aux [] body in
  760. ‌    let attr = default_stub_attribute in
  761.     [(fun_id, lfunction ~kind ~params ~return ~body ~attr ~loc); inner]
  762.   with Exit ->
  763.     [(fun_id, lfunction ~kind ~params ~return ~body ~attr ~loc)]

  765. (* Simplify local let-bound functions: if all occurrences are
  766.    fully-applied function calls in the same "tail scope", replace the
  767.    function by a staticcatch handler (on that scope).

  769.    This handles as a special case functions used exactly once (in any
  770.    scope) for a full application.
  771. *)

  773. ‌type slot =
  774.   {
  775.     func: lfunction;
  776.     function_scope: lambda;
  777.     mutable scope: lambda option;
  778.   }

  780. module LamTbl = Hashtbl.Make(struct
  781. ‌    type t = lambda
  782. ‌    let equal = (==)
  783. ‌    let hash = Hashtbl.hash
  784.   end)

  786. ‌let simplify_local_functions lam =
  787.   let slots = Hashtbl.create 16 in
  788.   let static_id = Hashtbl.create 16 in (* function id -> static id *)
  789.   let static = LamTbl.create 16 in (* scope -> static function on that scope *)
  790.   (* We keep track of the current "tail scope", identified
  791.      by the outermost lambda for which the the current lambda
  792.      is in tail position. *)
  793.   let current_scope = ref lam in
  794.   (* PR11383: We will only apply the transformation if we don't have to move
  795.      code across function boundaries *)
  796.   let current_function_scope = ref lam in
  797.   let check_static lf =
  798.     if lf.attr.local = Always_local then
  799.       Location.prerr_warning (to_location lf.loc)
  800.         (Warnings.Inlining_impossible
  801.            "This function cannot be compiled into a static continuation")
  802.   in
  803. ‌  let enabled = function
  804.     | {local = Always_local; _}
  805.     | {local = Default_local; inline = (Never_inline | Default_inline); _}
  806.       -> true
  807.     | {local = Default_local;
  808.        inline = (Always_inline | Unroll _ | Hint_inline); _}
  809.     | {local = Never_local; _}
  810.       -> false
  811.   in
  812. ‌  let rec tail = function
  813.     | Llet (_str, _kind, id, Lfunction lf, cont) when enabled lf.attr ->
  814.         let r =
  815.           { func = lf;
  816.             function_scope = !current_function_scope;
  817.             scope = None }
  818.         in
  819.         Hashtbl.add slots id r;
  820.         tail cont;
  821.         begin match Hashtbl.find_opt slots id with
  822.         | Some {scope = Some scope; _} ->
  823.             let st = next_raise_count () in
  824.             let sc =
  825.               (* Do not move higher than current lambda *)
  826.               if scope == !current_scope then cont
  827.               else scope
  828.             in
  829.             Hashtbl.add static_id id st;
  830.             LamTbl.add static sc (st, lf);
  831.             (* The body of the function will become an handler
  832.                in that "scope". *)
  833.             with_scope ~scope lf.body
  834.         | _ ->
  835.             check_static lf;
  836.             (* note: if scope = None, the function is unused *)
  837.             function_definition lf
  838.         end
  839.     | Lapply {ap_func = Lvar id; ap_args; _} ->
  840.         begin match Hashtbl.find_opt slots id with
  841.         | Some {func; _}
  842.           when exact_application func ap_args = None ->
  843.             (* Wrong arity *)
  844.             Hashtbl.remove slots id
  845.         | Some {scope = Some scope; _} when scope != !current_scope ->
  846.             (* Different "tail scope" *)
  847.             Hashtbl.remove slots id
  848.         | Some {function_scope = fscope; _}
  849.           when fscope != !current_function_scope ->
  850.             (* Non local function *)
  851.             Hashtbl.remove slots id
  852.         | Some ({scope = None; _} as slot) ->
  853.             (* First use of the function: remember the current tail scope *)
  854.             slot.scope <- Some !current_scope
  855.         | _ ->
  856.             ()
  857.         end;
  858.         List.iter non_tail ap_args
  859.     | Lvar id ->
  860.         Hashtbl.remove slots id
  861.     | Lfunction lf ->
  862.         check_static lf;
  863.         function_definition lf
  864.     | lam ->
  865.         Lambda.shallow_iter ~tail ~non_tail lam
  866. ‌  and non_tail lam =
  867.     with_scope ~scope:lam lam
  868.   and function_definition lf =
  869.     let old_function_scope = !current_function_scope in
  870.     current_function_scope := lf.body;
  871.     non_tail lf.body;
  872.     current_function_scope := old_function_scope
  873.   and with_scope ~scope lam =
  874.     let old_scope = !current_scope in
  875.     current_scope := scope;
  876.     tail lam;
  877.     current_scope := old_scope
  878.   in
  879.   tail lam;
  880. ‌  let rec rewrite lam0 =
  881.     let lam =
  882.       match lam0 with
  883.       | Llet (_, _, id, _, cont) when Hashtbl.mem static_id id ->
  884.           rewrite cont
  885.       | Lapply {ap_func = Lvar id; ap_args; _} when Hashtbl.mem static_id id ->
  886.          let st = Hashtbl.find static_id id in
  887.          let slot = Hashtbl.find slots id in
  888.          begin match exact_application slot.func ap_args with
  889.            | None -> assert false
  890.            | Some exact_args ->
  891.               Lstaticraise (st, List.map rewrite exact_args)
  892.          end
  893.       | lam ->
  894.           Lambda.shallow_map rewrite lam
  895.     in
  896.     List.fold_right
  897.       (fun (st, lf) lam ->
  898.          Lstaticcatch (lam, (st, lf.params), rewrite lf.body)
  899.       )
  900.       (LamTbl.find_all static lam0)
  901.       lam
  902.   in
  903.   if LamTbl.length static = 0 then
  904.     lam
  905.   else
  906.     rewrite lam

  908. (* The entry point:
  909.    simplification
  910.    + rewriting of tail-modulo-cons calls
  911.    + emission of tailcall annotations, if needed
  912. *)

  914. ‌let simplify_lambda lam =
  915.   let lam =
  916.     lam
  917.     |> (if !Clflags.native_code || not !Clflags.debug
  918.         then simplify_local_functions else Fun.id
  919.        )
  920.     |> simplify_exits
  921.     |> simplify_lets
  922.     |> Tmc.rewrite
  923.   in
  924.   if !Clflags.annotations
  925.      || Warnings.is_active (Warnings.Wrong_tailcall_expectation true)
  926.   then emit_tail_infos true lam;
  927.   lam

One Level Up Top Level
